newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Ascom chairman expects 1997 net profit.
newsitem.headline: Ascom chairman expects 1997 net profit.

text.p: Felix Wittlin, chairman of Ascom Holding AG, said he expected the company to return to a net profit in 1997 but declined to make a specific forecast.
"Personally I am expecting a net profit but I cannot give you an estimate of its size," Wittlin told a news conference.
Wittlin also said Ascom was budgeting for a "decent operating result" in 1997.
Ascom also said restructuring provisions of 152.1 million Swiss francs taken in 1996 should cover all legacies of the past.

These provisions were not taken to make Ascom look more desirable for a merger or alliance with another company, Wittlin added. "The precautionary provisions were not taken to beautify us for a marriage," he said.
Ascom plunged into a group net loss of 128.1 million francs in 1996 from a 1995 net profit of 25 million. Its operating profit rose to 94.1 million from 75.2 million in 1995.
